alert.note: Alert for Delaware; Eastern Chester; Eastern Montgomery; Lower Bucks; Upper Bucks; Western Chester; Western Montgomery (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 22 at 5:43PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Montgomery, west central Bucks, northeastern Chester and north central Delaware Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 543 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over King Of Prussia, or 12 miles northeast of West Chester, moving north at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Norristown, Phoenixville, Lansdale, West Norriton, East Norriton, Quakertown, Perkasie, Doylestown, Conshohocken, Souderton, Bedminster, Collegeville, Chalfont, Trappe, Hatfield, Dublin, Schwenksville, Green Lane, Fricks and Bryn Mawr. This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 319 and 335. Northeast Extension between mile markers 21 and 45. Interstate 76 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 327 and 333. Interstate 476 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 9 and 19. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for eastern and southeastern Pennsylvania.

area.areaDesc: Delaware; Eastern Chester; Eastern Montgomery; Lower Bucks; Upper Bucks; Western Chester; Western Montgomery
